alert.note: Alert for Dyer (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 7:30PM CDT until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... North Fork of the Forked Deer at Dyersburg For the North Fork Forked Deer River...including Dyersburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork of the Forked Deer at Dyersburg. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Most low-lying areas south and southeast of Dyersburg are flooding. Water is beginning to flow over Bean Mill Road in southeast Dyersburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 23.0 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
